pros: Great benefits, I have completed my masters degree and have only paid 25% of the total tuition costs.
cons: High turnover, they don';t invest in leadership development and its hard to move up in this organization.

review_title: One of the best university for funding opportunities and research work.
pros: Research university and good funding opportunity as well as living expenses at tucson are very less.
cons: As it is a research university hence very limited course work is offered. As well as very less industry exposure compared to cities like San Jose and LA.

pros:
Great place to work!!
I would go back any day!
Beautiful place to live!
People are great.
Very supportive atmosphere.
cons:
Not super high pay, but that is expected for my position.
As with most universities, some bureaucracy is to be expected.

review_title: Great benefits, meh salaries and limited advancement opportunities
pros: Benefits, great and friendly co workers. Vacation time is basically unlimited.
cons: Salaries aren't the greatest, and pay raises are extremely rare. Additionally, there are extremely limited opportunities in terms of promotion.

review_title: Great benefits and work environment, but lower pay.
pros: Great benefits package.  Always flexible for work hours.  Interesting projects.  Diversity in job activities - not stuck to just one specific task.
cons: Salary is lower than competitors.  Promotions and raises come infrequently.

pros: Friendly knowledgeable people that can help you advance your career in many aspects whether it be research or engineering field.
cons: slow paced and often times not organized. getting funding is a constant issue but overall the culture isnt that bad.

pros:
The professors encourage students to do great things.
Fairly easy to integrate with school studies.
Opportunities to publish work or be included in the paper writing process.
cons:
Some professors require more hours than others.
Deadlines can create added stress during busy times of the semester.
Many volunteers looking for similar positions, requiring extra effort to stand out.

pros: GREAT benefits. Flexibility. Lots of Perks. All holidays off are paid.
cons: Prepare to be underpaid by a large margin. Prepare to deal with the weird demands and outdated attitudes of seasoned academics.

pros: Good balance with school schedule, easy to schedule time off, allow you to return for the fall if you fly back home for the summer.
cons: The pay is below average, and the politics are much higher than your normal workplace due to it because a government job and an education institution.

review_title: Your experience will depend on your supervisor and team.
pros:
-A lot of great, hard-working co-workers
-It's nice to know you're helping students and some of them are very appreciative
-Fabulous tuition discounts for any state university
-Reasonable health benefits and wellness program
-Easy access to campus goings-on
cons:
-Bureaucracy
-Not a livable wage for support staff (though among the higher ones for Tucson)
-Unreasonable expectations from those outside department
-No raises

review_title: It was easy and I knew exactly what I had to do.
pros: Very flexible hours and the coworkers are very nice.
cons: The supervisor likes to micromanage and sometimes scold you even if you are doing your job right in order to make you think that you can't fool around.

pros: If you are into research this is a great University. Beautiful weather and wonderful campus.
cons: Old guard blocks will get in the way of growth and change at times. Politics can be difficult for the new personnel to navigate.

pros: This job has lots of flexibility, great benefits, very interesting projects, smart folks to work with, and good proximity to Tucson.
cons: The University is very fragmented in its administrative support.  Projects tend to be prototypical, so continuity in production is challenging.

review_title: Great Place to Work as a Student
pros: Managers understand that school is your main priority and are willing to be flexible with your schedule and workload, especially when working in an office setting
cons: The pay isn't crazy good, but it's something. And as a student, your hours are capped at 20-25 hours a week I believe, so something to keep in mind.

job_title: Instructional Design Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: The staff members of the Office of Digital Learning are some of the best people around. They were flexible with my schedule as a student worker, and provided a lot of opportunities to learn new skills. Would highly recommend the ODL!
cons: No cons - I was only a student worker so I can't say much more.

review_title: Nice as a temporary position until I find something better.
pros: Minimal supervision. Delivering mail all around beautiful campus gets me out of the office which is enjoyable unless it's 115 degrees outside. Nice coworkers who respect me.
cons: No benefits and low pay as a temporary hire position. No tuition discounts if I decide to take classes. It's only part time.

review_title: Pay isn't great but super flexible for schedules
pros: I really enjoyed being a student worker here. They're typically very flexible with your school schedule and understand that academics come first.
cons: You're not paid very well. Technically, since it's a state institution they don't need to adhere to the new minimum wage so you earn below that as a student worker.

review_title: Good jobs for students, pay isn't the best
job_title: Lab Preproom Attendant in Encino, CA
pros: Extremely flexible hours, can study while on the job
cons: Pay was below minimum wage (after AZ switched to $10/hour) when I left; university said they could determine wage due to being a state university.

review_title: Research Technician at Steele Children's Research Center
pros: UA is a great employer! The benefits are amazing and very well priced. I was able to flex my hours depending on needs, i.e. doctor's appointments, etc. I had a good balance of independence and collaboration with others in this position.
cons: Employees have to pay for parking/buy a permit which is pretty expensive.

job_title: Coordinator, Research Administration in Tucson, AZ
pros: Good pay and good benefits. Department heads seem really invested in their departments and employees.
cons: Parking can be a nightmare. Management can be detached.

review_title: Great Place to work if you want opportunity
pros: Great weather and people. The University is very organized in the way they run things. Athletics department is the best place to work!
cons: salary is not the best. Nothing too bad to say about anything else. Depending on what department you are in, your boss could make you want to leave.

review_title: My experience has been pretty much on par with what I expected.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: I'm a graduate student, and I work my own hours and have lots of support from faculty and staff.  I have a lot of flexibility.
cons: The pay isn't great as a graduate student, but it's not going to be great anywhere. It's enough to be gt by.

pros: I enjoy working in my department. People are collaborative rather than competitive and it's an environment with exciting research being done all the time.
cons: For graduate assistants, pay and job security vary widely by department. Some don't make enough to live on and don't know whether they will have funding from one semester to the next.

review_title: Horrible pay, Lack of Career Advancement
pros:
Great benefits package
Tuition assistance
Tons of departments to move to if you are unhappy with your present one
cons:
Horrible pay relative to similar jobs
State budget cuts can make job much harder
Senior management rarely knows your job duties which leaves little incentive to go the extra mile

review_title: It was a good entry level job for me to start with
pros: They are really good with fitting your school schedule with your work schedule, which is very important for college students.
cons: There was no room for improvement or promotions, making work unexciting because there were no incentives to move up within the university as a student worker.

pros: The best university I've worked for in my career.  Flat organization with room to grow.  Promote good people and good people are recognized.
cons: The ups and downs of working for a state right now; uncertain budgets, the demand to be more self sufficient in funding puts pressure on each department and individual.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Tucson, AZ
pros: Beautiful inexpensive city to live in. The weather is great in the winter, and this town has a lot of keen craft beer drinkers.
cons: Too hot from May-October, the university does not require PIs to pay to NIH scale, Arizona is a conservative state and benefits do not apply for first 3 months of employment.

job_title: 24/7 IT Support Center Technical Consultant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Easy to find student employment as long as you are committed to it. Departments/units are generally very flexible in meeting your needs as a student - they always try to schedule around your class schedule.
cons: Hard to get raises due to budget constraints.

review_title: postdoc in Chemistry and Biochemistry Department
pros: nice people, great support staff, good opportunity to advance
cons: not enough connections with other departments to collaborate. Lack of interest in students or postdoc work that made it almost impossible to actually develop projects in a timely manner.

pros: This university is full of smart, hard working people.  I have learned a lot from my three years there.  Most employees and faculty members are more approachable than those from other campuses.
cons: I worry about the budget of this university as the state of Arizona continues to cut education at every level.

job_title: Student Office Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: They are flexible with your scheduling, and work with you on any difficulties you might be having! The office is incredibly supportive!
cons: Working at the Dean's office you are expected to hold yourself with some accord. Other than that there really isn't much cons, if you consider that a con!

pros: I have the opportunity to get hands-on experience in real world engineering problems. Flexible schedule.
cons: If someone is not ready to learn new things or open-minded about new ideas, this is definitely not a place to be. Pay rate is not very high if you are currently going to school.

pros: UA is a fantastic place for a new professional to start or a seasoned professional end. Although Higher Ed can be political the majority of the people I worked collaboratively and not silo themselves away. The benefits were solid as well.
cons: It could have been my position, but the pay could have been more desirable.

review_title: Top research university that still has affordable faculty housing withing walking distance.
pros: Terrific work environment, great colleagues.
cons: low pay and no maternity leave for faculty

review_title: Find another place to revise your resume.
pros:
Nice weather in winter.
Bikini girls in campus.
cons:
It is not a place to work proudly. 
1. The undergraduate students are foolish and lazy, even the graduate students are same.
2. The administrative staffs are also very slow to handle their loads.
3. Overall, everything is not organized.

pros: The Daily Wildcat is a great place for students who are serious about getting into journalism. It looks great on your resume and it's a great place to get real experience.
cons: It does not pay well, but the line on your resume is well worth the time.

review_title: Teaching in Chemistry is not a bad gig
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: The hours aren't bad, and the classes are well-managed. Students are generally pleasant.
cons: Grading is a nightmare, and the out-of-class work (like grading tests, etc) is a drain on anything else you're trying to get done. There are not really any sick days as you might imagine.

pros: Great, casual work environment. Benefits and being able to get tuition reduction to help pay for education.
cons: Salary/pay raises are far and few between, often times there is a period of three or two years before you are given merit raises.

review_title: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: It's a university! People come here to learn things and advance the frontiers of human knowledge. That is pretty awesome whichever way you cut it.
cons: Administrators have vastly inflated salaries and the expanding bureaucracy is bleeding the academic mission of the university dry.

pros: Great experience with amazing people. Everyone is very helpful and I learned tons. Amazing place to work and grow as a person.
cons: It was far away from my place and the hot weather does not make it easier. Also, there was a lot of construction while I was there, but they will be done soon.

pros: Constantly trying to make your workload more manageable, students are great! The vibe is good... Always trying to improve the curriculum, teaching, etc.
cons: At times leadership is unorganized and some professors play favorites with TAs during evaluations

pros: The university is very flexible with student workers because it understands that student workers have exams, projects and other things going on in their lives.
cons: The pay at the university isn't as high compared to corporations. The turnover rate is high because many people move onto other places for career advancement.

review_title: Review of the Think Tank (student tutor position)
pros:
• Hours built around your schedule 
• Higher than average pay for student position on campus 
• Supervisors are awesome and understanding 
• Clear opportunities for advancement
cons:
• System that notifies tutors of individual appointments is not very efficient
• Certain students can be unpleasant to work with

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: As a graduate assistant, I stuck to 20 hours a week. ONLY. No more, no less, which was great to balance coursework and writing a dissertation.
cons: Poor management and lack of leadership and direction.

review_title: Writing Center is Great and Getting Better
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros:
The Writing Program Director (Susan Miller-Cochran) is awesome and really cares about everyone who works fo the WP.
Pretty reasonable flexibility with what you want to teach
Livable and reasonable stipend for Tucson
cons:
The graduate stipend is just barely enough to live--don't expect to save
No dental or much vision benefits

pros: Though it is not a famous college, it is still nice to work here. Good weather in this city, and not a lot of stress.
cons: As mentioned, this college is located in a small city, so there is not much job opportunity for the people here if they want to change job.

pros: really nice coworkers, nice boss and a very fulfilling goals in the projects.
cons: they ask too many requirements to hire you, too much formats and paper work to fill up.

pros: good work environment, nice working facilities, world class research, good health and other benefits, flexible working hour, city is nice to live, low expanses
cons: low salary, no fixed working hour, job is not permanent mostly depend on funding, scarcity of funding.

pros: flexible schedule, bookstore discount, good supervisors
cons: pay, training, higher up supervisors

pros: State of the art facility, easy access from campus/downtown, phenomenal people. Even a great cafe downstairs
cons: Not very well known despite pros;

pros: Enjoy work, beautiful setting, lots of wildlife and outdoors viewing
cons: Low pay, no benefits, part-time position only

review_title: University of Arizona Career Services Department is a great place to work!
pros: Great benefits including less than $100 per semester for your college education and the education of your immediate family.
cons: If you don't live near enough to walk or ride a bike to campus the parking cost can be a bit prohibitive.

job_title: Student Web Developer in Tucson, AZ
pros:
- Not high intensity environment
- Management is very understanding towards student developers
- Great place to meet other like minded individuals
- Provides an environment to learn and apply coding fundamentals
cons:
- Outdated development stacks
- Sketchy backup systems

pros: Great benefits, job security, insurance, clean buildings, tuition reduction, paid holidays off, you get to work and live in Tucson which has a very reasonable cost of living
cons: Some of the bad things about working at the university is that you can get stuck in one position without prospect of moving ahead

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Great support and learning opportunities from faculty and graduate students! Undergraduate students were also encouraged and able to propose research projects to faculty/staff.
cons: No regular team meetings, compensation was low, repetitive tasks were given to undergraduate students unless they pursued their own research interests with the support of faculty

job_title: Enrollment Relationship Manager in Tukwila, WA
pros: Positive environment,  paid time off, paid sick time, full benefits, 401k, aggressive salary, education benefit, severance package
cons: Workforce reductions lead to lay off.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant & Research Fellow in Tucson, AZ
pros: Plenty of time for research/writing; teaching experience accrues regularly; access to professors is excellent (though this varies by department)
cons: Some courses create disproportionate workload:pay ratio; student enthusiasm is sometimes dismal; schedule/location should be optimized--there's no reason to have one class halfway across campus, ten minutes after teaching a different class.

job_title: IT Support Specialist in Tucson, AZ
pros: Very easygoing office rules.
cons: Expect to support anything and everything that the UofA has to offer. It can be very frustrating sometimes. Wages were not high enough for the amount of work required.

pros: Great insurance and benefits and tuition reimbursement opportunities.  Some nice and interesting people. Great school    and biggest employer in this  town.
cons: Low pay, micromanagers, no yearly or good raises, no advancement opportunities, leadership doesn't listen to suggestions or complaints. Overworked and underappreciated.

job_title: Computer Lab Consultant in Tucson, AZ
pros: If you are good with computers, this will be a straight forward job of answering a few questions regarding software; management allows homework to be done I downtime.
cons: Some clients can be a bit indignant about enforcement of a no eating policy

pros: The weather is obviously a good benefit.  There are a lot of smart professors and cutting edge research being done on campus.
cons: The budget cuts from the state of Arizona are difficult and have affected most departments.  The facilities are lacking compared to private schools.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate I in Tucson, AZ
pros: Very professional professor and staff. The topic of research coincides with my field of interest. All necessary equipment and materials are provided
cons: Too hot climate, boring city, It is hard to find the place for parking. The nature is poor and has no interesting places besides the grand canyon

review_title: great college environment & great college town
pros: the town is great.  UA is the only show in town so thats fun.  UA also carries weight because they are a recognized brand.
cons: still a small town with small town vision.  great place to start.  kind of like training wheels.

pros: The university faculty life is exciting.  It provides independence and allows one to pursue research interests. Tucson is a fantastic place to live.
cons:
Salary increases happen rarely.  Being a state school, there are always budget cuts. 
Summer can be really hot at times.

pros: Excellent company to work for.  Improving ones skills is consistent and encouraged..
cons: Working for the state of Arizona and the government jobs are eliminated all the time.  Salaries are low and raises are few.

pros: Get to watch a hockey game while working. The work that is in need to be done is easy. Get to go on the ice during intermissions for promotions
cons: Don't get free food. This position is an unpaid internship. Work either Thursday, Friday or Saturday nights.

pros: Excellent benefits and work life balance.
cons: Salary is a little below average, but the benefits, environment, and job satisfaction are fantastic.

pros: I was able to do research that I am passionate about and build skills. I also got health insurance.
cons: No mentoring, for a post doc research position. Promises made that were not even remotely kept. Technically, seem to have been in the dark. Ethics a little murky.

pros: It is a large university with very brilliant students and professors. Some department and college, including optical sciences and planetary sciences and so on are really on the top. You can learn a lot here.
cons: The weather is not quite friendly in summer.

review_title: Great place to work when you're a student.
pros:
Great flexibility with your class schedule. 
Convenient place to work while you're in school - you can literally work in between class times.
cons: Most student/part-time jobs typically don't pay very well. You'll earn a little over minimum wage in most undergrad positions.

pros: Competitive pay and good experience. Many different jobs and on campus! Working with great people and I get to learn a lot. Very flexible work hours usually.
cons: There aren't very many downsides. For a part time job with no degree required these jobs are an amazing opportunity.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros:
Tend to be very flexible with hours depending on class schedule.
Get to engage with students.
Decent experience, get to interact with intelligent people.
cons:
Minimum wage - but the job doesn't deserve too much more than minimum wage, so take that as you will.
Lots of training.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: The faculty mentors at the university are very supportive and understanding. Graduate school is stressful, however, having such good mentors makes  it a little better.
cons: Parking is generally horrible. As with most universities you need to get in quite early to get a decent spot.

review_title: Review of Univ. of  Arizona PhD program
job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Tucson, AZ
pros: Top-notch facilities, researchers, classes, and supportive staff scientists.
cons: PhD program in general has its challenges; student support can be up and down in terms of making sure your progressing through the program (i.e., helping you identify where you are falling behind/lacking).

review_title: Good research in a relatively relaxed environment
pros: Top-notch academic research in the fields of optical sciences, planetary sciences. Great opportunities for collaboration. Rhythms are relaxed, but this is research: it depends on personal factors and on the advisor.
cons: High-level politics are often obscure. Department administration and bureaucracy is sometimes sluggish.

review_title: Great place to work, very friendly faculty
job_title: Graduate Research/Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros:
The living expense in Tucson is pretty cheap. 
The faculty are very helpful and friendly, which makes it easier to work with them on some research project.
cons:
The weather in the summer is unbearable. 
Some areas (the South) are not very safe

review_title: Campus Recreation is a great experience for college students
job_title: Student Marketing Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Huge staff, mainly students. Depending on your supervisor, they really try to prepare you for the "real" working world. They offer free professional development lectures and classes, too.
cons: Having to pay for your required CPR certification.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: The faculty are great at this university, as are graduate colleagues.  There's lots of opportunities for graduate students to learn to teach.
cons: Lots of re-organization of the university structure to constantly cut the budget.   Graduate students teaching are often paid more than adjunct faculty.
